text: Till We Meet Again is a 1944 American drama film directed by Frank Borzage, written by Lenore J. Coffee, and starring Ray Milland, Barbara Britton, Walter Slezak, Lucile Watson, Konstantin Shayne, Vladimir Sokoloff and Mona Freeman. It was released on August 30, 1944, by Paramount Pictures. ==Plot== == Cast == *Ray Milland as John *Barbara Britton as Sister Clothilde / Louise Dupree *Walter Slezak as Vitrey *Lucile Watson as Mother Superior *Konstantin Shayne as Major Krupp *Vladimir Sokoloff as Cabeau *Mona Freeman as Elise *William Edmunds as Henri Maret ==Radio adaptation== Till We Meet Again was presented on the Kate Smith Hour September 24, 1944. Jeanne Cagney and Franchot Tone starred in the adaptation. == References == == External links == * * A WWII pilot (Milland)with vital information for the allies is shot down in Nazi occupied France. A young nun(Britton)sacrifices to help him escape.
